text: An EFF to watch the EFF?
description: They are no longer defending electronic freedom, they are protecting the rich monopolists.

subs.text: The EFF started, 30 years ago today, with the right idea, defending speech on the then-nascent net. I gave them $5000 at startup, but ultimately they sold us out to the big tech companies. Now we need a new EFF to reign in the original EFF.

I blogged about my first break with the EFF in 2005. Subsequently I objected to how they defended podcasting from a patent troll, and ultimately the effort to give control of the web to Google, that was the absolute last straw.
They are no longer defending electronic freedom, they are protecting the rich monopolists. Ugh.
